headline: Hithium signs 1GWh residential and C&I BESS distribution agreement in Pakistan
summary_80w: Hithium has partnered with The Imperial Electric Company to deliver 1GWh of energy storage across Pakistan's residential and C&I sectors.

headline: Fire testing heats up as Chinese energy storage firms wage ‘extreme safety’ battle
summary_80w: Energy storage system safety is being taken to new levels, as evidenced by the fire testing efforts of Chinese market players, writes Carrie Xiao.

headline: Australia’s AGL Energy dedicates AU$900 million to battery storage as net profit dips 21% year-on-year
summary_80w: AGL Energy has deployed approximately AU$900 million toward BESS and renewables in Australia during the fiscal year ending June 2025.

headline: Australia to introduce Developer Rating Scheme for renewables and energy storage
summary_80w: The Australian government has appointed multinational consumer credit agency Equifax Australasia Credit Ratings to design, develop, implement, and operate a new Developer Rating Scheme.

headline: Australia: Victoria updated Transmission Plan adds new REZ, 200,000 hectares
summary_80w: The Australian government of Victoria has released an amended version of the Victorian Transmission Plan, adding 200,000 hectares of area to develop renewable energy – in addition to 230,000 hectares proposed in the first draft.

headline: After the blackout
summary_80w: Jonathan Touriño Jacobo explores evidence of systemic problems in the Iberian grid and some of the solutions following the blackout.

headline: New Stonepeak Middle East renewables vehicle to be led by ex-Jinko executive
summary_80w: Investment fund Stonepeak has launched a new Middle Eastern renewables platform headed up by a former executive at Jinko Power.

headline: Tindo launches new Australia-made TOPCon PV modules
summary_80w: Australia’s sole PV producer Tindo Solar has launched a new range of n-type TOPCon modules aimed at rooftop applications.

headline: US solar industry attacks tightened safe harbour rules for ITC qualification
summary_80w: US solar industry representatives have voiced concern at the US Treasury Department’s new “start of construction” rules for large projects.

headline: LONGi unveils new lightweight BC module for rooftop C&I
summary_80w: Chinese module manufacturer LONGI has launched a new back-contact (BC) lightweight module for commercial and industrial (C&I) rooftop applications.

headline: Maxeon’s module shipments fall by 90% over two years amid border dispute
summary_80w: Maxeon shipped just 153.2MW of modules in the first half of this year, just 15% of the capacity sold in the first half of 2024.

headline: Australia to develop national solar module reuse and recycling scheme
summary_80w: Australia’s federal, state and territory governments have agreed to develop a national solar module reuse and recycling scheme.

headline: Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners acquires 1GWh BESS project from EDF Renewables North America
summary_80w: Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP) has acquired full ownership of the 1GWh Beehive battery energy storage system (BESS) in Arizona, US, from EDF Renewables North America.

headline: Iron flow battery maker ESS Inc warns of survival battle through ‘operational reset’ period
summary_80w: Iron flow battery company ESS Tech Inc (ESS Inc) has warned of substantial doubts about its ability to survive another year.

headline: India’s NTPC tenders EPC contracts for 4GWh battery storage at thermal power plants
summary_80w: State-owned power producer NTPC has issued a tender for battery energy storage system (BESS) projects at thermal power plants in Uttar Pradesh, India.

headline: Ausgrid commissions 5MW community battery in New South Wales, Australia
summary_80w: Australian network company Ausgrid has commissioned its largest community battery to date, a 5MW system in Cooranbong in the Central Coast region of New South Wales.

headline: Spearmint Energy gets greenlight for Texas City BESS, as a further 860MW+ of capacity withdrawn from ERCOT queue
summary_80w: Miami, Florida-based developer Spearmint Energy has been given the go-ahead to develop a 300MW/600MWh lithium-ion BESS destined for Texas City in the Lone Star State.

headline: Australia’s HumeLink opens for renewable power and storage project connections
summary_80w: Australia’s transmission line infrastructure project HumeLink is now open for connection to solar, wind, and energy storage facilities.

headline: T1 Energy, Corning sign ‘landmark’ US-made solar poly, wafer, cell supply deal
summary_80w: US solar manufacturer T1 Energy has signed a deal to buy US-made polysilicon and wafers from ceramics and glass producer Corning.

headline: Viridi claims its BESS products meet the One Big Beautiful Bill’s FEOC requirements
summary_80w: Viridi Parente has announced its battery energy storage systems (BESS) products meet the current Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC) requirements as expanded under the One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBB).
